description: This foundation-level studio course introduces the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical
foundations of new media art making. New media is a broad category that includes a variety of art
practices. Areas of focus may include video art, filmmaking, sound art, animation, performance and
other digital, time-based, and/or interactive processes. Idea generation and creative development
is central to the course, with an emphasis on experimentation and divergent thinking. Students
engage in demonstrations, exercises, group work, reflection, and creative projects. Offered each
